text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to identify UK civil litigation rules as including proportional pre-trial discovery. The candidate answer addresses UK procedural rules in Section 2, noting: '• Civil Procedure Rules (CPR) Part 31 (disclosure) – broad, \u201creasonable steps\u201d test.' While the term 'proportional' is more strongly associated with the US discovery regime (and is mentioned in the context of California discovery in the table), the CPR Part 31 disclosure regime in the UK is fundamentally governed by the principle of proportionality (CPR 31.4 and the overriding objective).
